Little Jack Horner designs for #pussinbootsthelastwish -I had so much fun designing this guy but even more fun hearing @johnmulaney improvisations, bringing this despicable character to life on screen. Thank you to @circle_persnickety @joel.crawford.art @jmercado and #natewragg for bringing me onto this film with such a great collaborative and supportive team of artists and managers. Soooooooo many more designs coming… brace yourself for a lot of puss in boots 2 posts. #teamfriendship

2022 was a beautiful year that brought me back to Paris twice, my third book and lots of time with the people (…and basset hound) I love the most in the world. As much as I complain about social media, I realize that it has pushed me to document these collections of observations through my sketchbooks. Looking forward to what sketches, paintings and stories 2023 will bring 🥂
.

Thrilled to share MAKE WAY's first review is a ⭐️ from @kirkus_reviews !

Kirkus calls MAKE WAY "a wonderful picture book about creativity and collaboration."

I can't wait for readers to learn about the story behind Make Way for Ducklings, and the hard work and perseverance of artists Robert McCloskey and Nancy Schön.

The book releases on April 11th, but is available for preorder now! (link in bio)

It’s a second ⭐️ for MAKE WAY, this time from @publisherswkly 

PW notes the interplay between words and pictures, writing: “Burke Kunkel (Digging for Words) renders a genuinely suspenseful and touching account of Schön delicately approaching McCloskey with the idea of memorializing his book’s characters. Handsome, vintage-style artwork by Keane (Little Wonder) recalls the warm sepia tones of McCloskey’s drawings and the brass of the sculptures; coupled with the story of both parties’ persistence, the pages feel like a natural extension of the original tale.”

MAKE WAY available for preorder now! (link in bio)

Im so excited to share this special book with the world coming out in a few weeks! This thoughtful double biography written by @angkunkel about children’s book author Robert McCloskey and sculptor Nancy Schön perfectly describes what it takes to follow through on an inspiration. I was so inspired looking through McCloskey’s researched and playful illustrations for Make Way for Ducklings. I felt so lucky to be able to immerse myself in such great work in order to complete my own. Preorder link in my bio!
.
.
.
.
.
.

More development art for Puss in Boots! This was a scene where @naveen.selvan ‘s charming and quaint bear cottage design gets ripped apart when goldi and puss both grab hold of the magic map) It was a tricky one since there were lots of high concept ideas to get across in one image and it all had to be shot somewhat straight on (not from left to right which my visual storyteller brain kept trying to do to make the action more clear) and I wasn’t sure how it would play out but the end result in the movie was one of my favorite scenes and it all ended up making sense. Bravo to all the storyboard artists and lighting team that made this scene work!
.

It’s been fun vacationing with these two- it’s been a summer full of cafes and sketchbooks 🍷🎨thankfully they are just as into it as I am 😂
.
.

#watercolorsketch
#watercolorsketching
#watercolorpainting
#watercolorartwork #watercolorjournal

Yesterday I visited my friend @louisthomas___ at his beautiful loft in Montmartre.
His work is full of aesthetic charm and his process is the kind that requires the greatest of skills, simplicity. When you swipe through you will see some of his book Le Livre de Tout that he made directly in a sketchbook without any pre sketching or post photoshop touch ups. (The second picture is of the printed book on the left and the original sketchbook on the right 😵😵) He also works this way for his large commission portraits which are done in person within a few hours only and directly on the canvas without a sketch. As someone who is constantly changing her mind about composition or redrawing my sketches over and over, throwing things out until the last minute, I am blown away by the amount of mastery and discipline this way of working takes. 
What a wonderful and inspiring afternoon.

.

What a joy chatting with Claire about the process of creation and the ongoing journey of finding our creative voices! I loved the opportunity to sit down with an artist I deeply admire, commiserate about our challenges, celebrate successes and learn together. 

A validating conversation. And one I wish I could send to my younger self. (nudge nudge, younger self, keep going, you're doing great.)

Go to femmeon.show to listen to the episode.

Show Notes:

Alyson and Claire Keane (artist, illustrator of books including her most recent Little Wonder and visual development artist on films including Puss in Boots: The Last Wish, Tangled and Frozen) talk about finding their creative voices. The conversation takes them through early obstacles, feeling like they had nothing left to say and being ready to give up entirely. And then, what next? Well, that’s what they talk about. How in order to keep creativity moving and sustainable, engaging with one’s voice (or tapping into the flow) is essential. It’s a fascinating conversation that will resonate with fans and artists and creatives. What is it like to create and what’s it like when creating is complicated? Come listen and find out!

#femmeonpodcast 
#clairekeane 
#findingyourcreativevoice

Trying to capture the movement of ocean waves in line drawing will always be a welcome challenge: the smooth part of the water leading into the frothy white part crashing on the sand and then the patterns in the water that recedes- it’s impossible to capture and yet so fun to try 🌊

Marie-Yaé Suematsu in her studio this summer. Her world inspires me so much. Her natural style, her patterns, her colors - all of it! My dream is to have a whole kitchen made of @marie.yae ‘s ceramics 😍 scroll through to see what I’m talking about. Also my dad gifted one of her beautiful vases to my mom for Christmas last year.
.

.
.

#warercolor #art #illustrator #ceramacist #paris #dailysketch #portrait #comissionsopen #sketch #drawing #sketchbook #sketchbookdrawing #potter #potterylife #pinchpottery #illustratedceramics #marieyaeceramics

Happy #100yearsofdisney ! 
This company has been a large part of my life from the very start visiting my dad on the lot when very small, to all my drawings of Cinderella and all the subsequent images that that movie inspired in me, to starting my career in the hat building. The inspiration that Walt started 100 years ago is significantly engrained in who I am as an artist and what I love the most about working in animation, the collaborative spirit and innovation. The 10 years I spent at Disney were (for a lack of a better less Disney-geek speak word) “magical” 😂 happy 100th to all my friends who’s path have been influenced by Walt’s innovation and determination 100 years ago. 

This is one of the only pics I could find of me at the studio - ironically taken 2 years after I left the studio on the day I received my 10 year plaque 🤷‍♀️. Anyway the rest of the images are a smattering of Disney stills and concept art by #Disney legends that are engrained in my soul that continue to inspire me today. #disney100

Join us Friday at @lightboxexpo at 1:45
 @sketchlingg @itslulubee #maureenfan

I’m excited to share that I recently opened commissions and the holiday spots have filled up much more quickly than anticipated but I have one or perhaps two more spots available if submitted before the end of November. Link to commission submissions and info in bio!

We have a winner! A few weeks ago I posted a signed book giveaway contest to see who could guess how many Basset Hounds were running around in I WANT 100 DOGS. The answer is 77 stinky basset hounds. and Dana Williams came in closest at 76 😍.
